intro: Ardisia rubescens, commonly known as the red-berried evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Ardisia rubescens is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal fruit display. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade in its natural habitat.
